decision_conditions: The proposed development would - by reason of inappropriate land use within the retail core of the Upminster Major District Centre - have an unacceptable impact on the long-term viability of the high street and is unacceptable when assessed against policies DC16 and DC23 of the Havering Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008.

The proposed development would - by reason for an inappropriately designed extract system, and the introduction of a late-night use in close proximity to residential uses - have an unacceptable impact on neighbouring amenity, and would be unacceptable when assessed against DC61 of the Havering Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008.

The proposed development would - by reason of its inappropriate shop front design - fail to integrate well into the existing building and the area more generally, and have an detrimental impact on the streetscene, and would be unacceptable when assessed against policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 (MALP), draft London Plan policy D4, and policies CP17 and DC61 of the Havering Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, and the Shop Front Design SPD.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent prior to issuing a decision on the application.
description: Change of use of the ground floor commercial units from Use Class A2 (financial services) to flexible Use Class A3 and A4 (Restaurant, Cafe, Drinking Establishment) involving consolidation of the units.
